description: A colored substance spread over surfaces to decorate them.
A tool with bristles used to apply paint on a canvas.
A rough drawing made quickly without much detail.
A soft, sticky earth material used to make pottery and sculptures.
A large painting applied directly to a wall or ceiling.
A board artists use to mix their paints on.
Art made by sticking various materials on a surface.
A stand for holding a painter's canvas while working.
A technique where water-based paints are applied on wet plaster.
A white paint mixture used as a base for painting.
The use of strong contrasts between light and dark in art.
A painting technique for softening transitions between colors.
A technique where paint is laid thickly on a surface.
A technique to represent an object extending back in space.
A shading technique using closely spaced parallel lines.
A technique of using small dots to simulate varying shades.
A small model for a sculpture or architectural project.
A sculpture technique where the figures are raised slightly.
A thin, smooth layer of paint or vitreous substance.
An initial layer of paint applied to a ground.
Drawings or writing painted on walls, often in public view.
A picture made by combining several different images.
A technique using tiny dots of color to create an image.
An outline of a figure filled in with a solid color.
A thick textile fabric with pictures or designs formed by weaving.
